stem: A 34-year-old woman is admitted to the Emergency Department following a collapse. The EKG shows a polymorphic ventricular tachycardia. Which one of the following is not associated with an increased risk of developing torsades de pointes?
disc:
Long QT syndromes are disorders of myocardial repolarization characterized by prolonged QT intervals (normal - 400ms). They predispose to polymorphic ventricular tachycardia and torsades de pointes (a life-threatening arrhythmia: atypical, rapid, and bizarre form of ventricular tachycardia characterized by a continuously changing axis of polymorphic QRS morphologies).

The clinical presentation is usually with syncope, palpitations, seizures, and cardiac arrest/death.

They can be either congenital or acquired. Congenital causes may predispose one to have acquired abnormalities in repolarization.

Congenital causes:
- Jervell and Lange-Nielsen syndrome
- Romano-Ward syndrome

Acquired causes:
- Metabolic - Hypocalcemia, Hypokalemia, Hypomagnesemia, Starvation
- Bradyarrhythmias - Sinus Nord dysfunction, AV block
- Antiinfective medications - Antimalarials, Azole antifungals, Fluoroquinolones, Antiretrovirals, Macrolides, Metronidazole
- Psychotropic medications - Antipsychotics, Tricyclics, Some SSRIS
- Others - Myocardial ischemia, Intracranial disease, Hypothermia, Toxins (organophosphates)
